issue.title: [CF 280] Text output bug and a lua error
issue.body:
Text output have a bug, sometimes when i cast bloodthirst will trigger text output of follow icon (pummel), you can see the picture.

^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Scooldown ^SUnAlpha^N0.99 ^SShowWhen^Salways ^SEvents^T ^S**^T ^SText^S ^SSound^SNone ^SChannel^S ^t^SOnStart^T ^SText^Stest. ^SChannel^SFRAME ^SLocation^SGeneral ^t^t^SEnabled^B ^SName^S6552 ^t^N45303^^

----
a lua error

1x AceLocale-3.0-6: TellMeWhen: Missing entry for "This condition type allows you to evaluate Lua code to determine the state of a condition.The input is not an 'if .. then' statement, nor is it a function closure. It is a regular statement to be evaluated, e.g. 'a and b or c'.  If complex functionality is required, use a call to a function, e.g. 'CheckStuff()', that is defined externally.If more help is needed (but not help about how to write Lua code), open a ticket on CurseForge. For help on how to write Lua, go to the interwebs."
TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen-r198.lua:3629: in function "TT"
TellMeWhen-r198\conditions.lua:1903: in function "name"
TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options-r198.lua:4227: in function "TypeCheck"
TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options-r198.lua:4361: in function "Load"
TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options-r198.lua:4186: in function "Load"
TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options-r198.lua:1783: in function "Load"
<string>:"*:OnMouseUp":5: in function <string>:"*:OnMouseUp":1

Locals:
nil


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl | Imported from CurseForge issue #280 | Raw

TellMeWhen.lua


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

Attachment Added: Test2.PNG

Test2.PNG


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

I think the text output bug may be bigger than just one icon. Could you post your whole saved variables file?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

I use my warrior to tested once more, it's don't happen again, i replace my saved variables to 08-07 is same, i can't see that bug, maybe it's not a bug, i think it is a uncommon problem, don't need do more thing for it.

By the way: everything is same, only one thing is different, in the morning, i have not play the warrior more than 4 days, is this a problem? or WOW is so jealous because i am so amazing and awesome?

Sorry, this isn't really a text output bug report.-.-

Edited Aug 17, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

May be a problem with Blizzard's API causing it to return non-zero values for bloodthirsty even when it isn't on CD. The way that events are handled makes it impossible for textures to get mixed up between icons, so it has to be an issue where the bloodthirsty cooldown is being triggered to something that isn't a GCD.

Oh well.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I'm not reproducing it either. Must just be a fluke. Wish I knew what was going on, though.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
